RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT SER-188, AND IDENTIFICATION
RP   BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=17242355; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0609836104;
RA   Villen J., Beausoleil S.A., Gerber S.A., Gygi S.P.;
RT   "Large-scale phosphorylation analysis of mouse liver.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 104:1488-1493(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in several stages of intracellular trafficking.
CC       Interacts with membranes containing phosphatidylinositol 3-
CC       phosphate (PtdIns(3P)) or phosphatidylinositol 3,5-bisphosphate
CC       (PtdIns(3,5)P2). Acts in part as component of the retromer
CC       membrane-deforming SNX-BAR subcomplex. The SNX-BAR retromer
CC       mediates retrograde transport of cargo proteins from endosomes to
CC       the trans-Golgi network (TGN) and is involved in endosome-to-
CC       plasma membrane transport for cargo protein recycling. The SNX-BAR
CC       subcomplex functions to deform the donor membrane into a tubular
CC       profile called endosome-to-TGN transport carrier (ETC). Can sense
CC       membrane curvature and has in vitro vesicle-to-membrane remodeling
CC       activity. Involved in retrograde endosome-to-TGN transport of
CC       lysosomal enzyme receptors (IGF2R, M6PR and SORT1). Plays a role
CC       in targeting ligand-activated EGFR to the lysosomes for
CC       degradation after endocytosis from the cell surface and release
CC       from the Golgi. Involvement in retromer-independent endocytic
CC       trafficking of P2RY1 and lysosomal degradation of protease-
CC       activated receptor-1/F2R. Promotes KALRN- and RHOG-dependent but
CC       retromer-independent membrane remodeling such as lamellipodium
CC       formation; the function is dependent on GEF activity of KALRN.
CC       Required for endocytosis of DRD5 upon agonist stimulation but not
CC       for basal receptor trafficking (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q13596}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Predominantly forms heterodimers with BAR domain-
CC       containing sorting nexins SNX5, SNX6 and SNX32 (By similarity).
CC       Can self-associate to form homodimers (PubMed:11726276). The
CC       heterodimers are proposed to self-assemble into helical arrays on
CC       the membrane to stabilize and expand local membrane curvature
CC       underlying endosomal tubule formation. Thought to be a component
CC       of the originally described retromer complex (also called SNX-BAR
CC       retromer) which is a pentamer containing the heterotrimeric
CC       retromer cargo-selective complex (CSC), also described as vacuolar
CC       protein sorting subcomplex (VPS) and a heterodimeric membrane-
CC       deforming subcomplex formed between SNX1 or SNX2 and SNX5 or SNX6
CC       (also called SNX-BAR subcomplex); the respective CSC and SNX-BAR
CC       subcomplexes associate with low affinity. Interacts with SNX5,
CC       SNX6, SNX32, VPS26A, VPS29, VPS35, DRD5, DENND5A, KALRN, RHOG
CC       (GDP-bound form). The interaction with SNX2 is reported
CC       controversially. Interacts with DNAJC13; prevented by presence of
CC       HGS. Interacts with HGS (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q13596, ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q99N27}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endosome membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q13596}; Peripheral membrane protein;
CC       Cytoplasmic side. Golgi apparatus, trans-Golgi network membrane
CC       {ECO:0000305}; Peripheral membrane protein {ECO:0000305};
CC       Cytoplasmic side {ECO:0000305}. Early endosome membrane;
CC       Peripheral membrane protein; Cytoplasmic side. Cell projection,
CC       lamellipodium {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q13596}. Note=Enriched on
CC       tubular elements of the early endosome membrane. Binds
CC       preferentially to highly curved membranes enriched in
CC       phosphatidylinositol 3-phosphate (PtdIns(3P)) or
CC       phosphatidylinositol 3,5-bisphosphate (PtdIns(3,5)P2). Colocalized
CC       with SORT1 to tubular endosomal membrane structures called
CC       endosome-to-TGN transport carriers (ETCs) which are budding from
CC       early endosome vacuoles just before maturing into late endosome
CC       vacuoles. Colocalized with F-actin at the leading edge of
CC       lamellipodia in a KALRN-dependent manner.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q13596}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The BAR domain is able to sense membrane curvature upon
CC       dimerization. Membrane remodeling seems to implicate insertion of
CC       a N-terminal amphipatric helix (AH) in the membrane (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q13596}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No visible phenotype. Mice are born at the
CC       expected Mendelian ratio and are fertile. Mice lacking both Snx1
CC       and Snx2 die during embryonic development, around 9.5 and 11.5
CC       dpc. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12388759}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Binds phosphatidylinositol 3-phosphate (PtdIns-
CC       (3)P) and phosphatidylinositol 3,5-bisphosphate (PtdIns-(3,5)P2)
CC       in liposome-based assays. Can bind PtdIns(3,4,5)P3 in
CC       protein:lipid overlay assays, but not in liposome-based assays (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the sorting nexin family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 BAR domain. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PX (phox homology) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00147}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RX   PubMed=15965486; DOI=10.1038/nsmb954;
RA   Collins B.M., Skinner C.F., Watson P.J., Seaman M.N., Owen D.J.;
RT   "Vps29 has a phosphoesterase fold that acts as a protein interaction
RT   scaffold for retromer assembly.";
RL   Nat. Struct. Mol. Biol. 12:594-602(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Acts as component of the retromer cargo-selective
CC       complex (CSC). The CSC is believed to be the core functional
CC       component of retromer or respective retromer complex variants
CC       acting to prevent missorting of selected transmembrane cargo
CC       proteins into the lysosomal degradation pathway. The recruitment
CC       of the CSC to the endosomal membrane involves RAB7A and SNX3. The
CC       SNX-BAR retromer mediates retrograde transport of cargo proteins
CC       from endosomes to the trans-Golgi network (TGN) and is involved in
CC       endosome-to-plasma membrane transport for cargo protein recycling.
CC       The SNX3-retromer mediates the retrograde endosome-to-TGN
CC       transport of WLS distinct from the SNX-BAR retromer pathway. The
CC       SNX27-retromer is believed to be involved in endosome-to-plasma
CC       membrane trafficking and recycling of a broad spectrum of cargo
CC       proteins. The CSC seems to act as recruitment hub for other
CC       proteins, such as the WASH complex and TBC1D5. Required to
CC       regulate transcytosis of the polymeric immunoglobulin receptor
CC       (pIgR-pIgA) (By similarity). Has no activity towards p-
CC       nitrophenylphosphate, p-nitrophenylphosphorylcholine or
CC       phosphatidylinositlphosphates or a phosphorylated peptide derived
CC       from retromer cargo (in vitro) (PubMed:21629666, PubMed:15965486).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UBQ0, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15965486,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21629666}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the heterotrimeric retromer cargo-selective
CC       complex (CSC), also described as vacuolar protein sorting
CC       subcomplex (VPS) formed by VPS26 (VPS26A or VPS26B), VPS29 and
CC       VPS35 (PubMed:21040701, PubMed:20875039, PubMed:21920005). The CSC
CC       has a highly elongated structure with VPS26 and VPS29 binding
CC       independently at opposite distal ends of VPS35 as central platform
CC       (By similarity). The CSC is believed to associate with variable
CC       sorting nexins to form functionally distinct retromer complex
CC       variants. The originally described retromer complex (also called
CC       SNX-BAR retromer) is a pentamer containing the CSC and a
CC       heterodimeric membrane-deforming subcomplex formed between SNX1 or
CC       SNX2 and SNX5 or SNX6 (also called SNX-BAR subcomplex); the
CC       respective CSC and SNX-BAR subcomplexes associate with low
CC       affinity. The CSC associates with SNX3 to form a SNX3-retromer
CC       complex. The CSC associates with SNX27, the WASH complex and the
CC       SNX-BAR subcomplex to form the SNX27-retromer complex (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with VPS26A, VPS26B, VPS35, ANKRD27
CC       (PubMed:20875039, PubMed:21920005, PubMed:24856514). Interacts
CC       with SNX1, SNX2, SNX27, KIAA0196 (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UBQ0, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15965486,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20875039, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21040701,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21920005, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24856514}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Peripheral membrane protein {ECO:0000250}. Endosome
CC       membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15965486}; Peripheral membrane
CC       protein {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15965486}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9QZ88-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9QZ88-2; Sequence=VSP_004074;
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the VPS29 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Was originally believed to be a metal-dependent
CC       phosphatase but shown to lack catalytic activity; can bind metals
CC       (Zn(2+) and Mn(2+)) with very low affinity suggesting that metal
CC       binding is not required for its function.
CC       {ECO:0000303|PubMed:15965486, ECO:0000303|PubMed:21629666}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for distribution of pericentromeric
CC       heterochromatin in interphase nuclei and for centromere formation
CC       and organization, chromosome alignment and cytokinesis.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Chromosome, centromere, kinetochore
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton,
CC       spindle {ECO:0000250}. Note=Enriched at the nuclear periphery and
CC       around the nucleolus. In mitotic cells, localizes to kinetochores
CC       from prometaphase to metaphase. At anaphase onset, transfers to
CC       the spindle midzone and then to the mid-body in telophase and
CC       cytokinesis (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

RA   Lee C.-H., Kominos D., Jacques S., Margolis B., Schlessinger J.,
RA   Shoelson S.E., Kuriyan J.;
RT   "Crystal structures of peptide complexes of the amino-terminal SH2
RT   domain of the Syp tyrosine phosphatase.";
RL   Structure 2:423-438(1994).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Acts downstream of various receptor and cytoplasmic
CC       protein tyrosine kinases to participate in the signal transduction
CC       from the cell surface to the nucleus. Dephosphorylates ROCK2 at
CC       Tyr-722 resulting in stimulatation of its RhoA binding activity.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14967142}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Protein tyrosine phosphate + H(2)O = protein
CC       tyrosine + phosphate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10044}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with CD84 and with phosphorylated SIT1 and
CC       MZPL1. Interacts with FCRL3, FCRL4, FCRL6 and ANKHD1. Interacts
CC       with GAREM (tyrosine phosphorylated); the interaction increases
CC       MAPK/ERK activity and does not affect the GRB2/SOS complex
CC       formation (By similarity). Interacts with PTPNS1 and BCAR3.
CC       Interacts with phosphorylated LIME1. Interacts with SHB and
CC       INPP5D/SHIP1. Interacts with KIR2DL1; the interaction is enhanced
CC       by ARRB2 (By similarity). Interacts with GAB2. Interacts with
CC       TERT; the interaction retains TERT in the nucleus. Interacts with
CC       PECAM1 and FER. Interacts with EPHA2 (activated); participates in
CC       PTK2/FAK1 dephosphorylation in EPHA2 downstream signaling (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with MILR1 (tyrosine phosphorylated).
CC       Interacts with FLT1 (tyrosine-phosphorylated), FLT3 (tyrosine-
CC       phosphorylated), FLT4 (tyrosine-phosphorylated), KIT and GRB2.
CC       Interacts with ROS1; mediates PTPN11 phosphorylation. Interacts
CC       with PDGFRA (tyrosine phosphorylated). Interacts with PDGFRB
CC       (tyrosine phosphorylated); this interaction increases the PTPN11
CC       phosphatase activity. Interacts (via SH2 domain) with TEK/TIE2
CC       (tyrosine phosphorylated). {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10068651, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10080542,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10521483, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10896938,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12181353, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14610044,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16684964, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16885344,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20526344, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7521735,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8943348, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9062191,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9110989, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9393882,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9528781, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9722576}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P30999:Ctnnd1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-397236, EBI-529924;
CC       P16879:Fes; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-397236, EBI-771815;
CC       P62993:GRB2 (xeno); NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-397236, EBI-401755;
CC       Q60631:Grb2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-397236, EBI-1688;
CC       P28776:Ido1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-397236, EBI-4410822;
CC       P10721:KIT (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-397236, EBI-1379503;
CC       P15209:Ntrk2; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-397236, EBI-309647;
CC       Q8K4V6:Pirb; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-397236, EBI-8602514;
CC       P70196:Traf6; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-397236, EBI-448028;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P35235-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P35235-2; Sequence=VSP_016675;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in brain, heart and kidney.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7681217}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The SH2 domains repress phosphatase activity. Binding of
CC       these domains to phosphotyrosine-containing proteins relieves this
CC       auto-inhibition, possibly by inducing a conformational change in
CC       the enzyme.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on Tyr-546 and Tyr-584 upon receptor protein
CC       tyrosine kinase activation; which creates a binding site for GRB2
CC       and other SH2-containing proteins. Phosphorylated upon activation
CC       of the receptor-type kinase FLT3. Phosphorylated by activated
CC       PDGFRB (By similarity). Phosphorylated upon activation of the
CC       receptor-type kinase PDGFRA. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10080542, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16885344,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8943348}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the protein-tyrosine phosphatase family.
CC       Non-receptor class 2 subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 SH2 domains. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00191}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 tyrosine-protein phosphatase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00160}.

RA   Grimmond S.M., Teasdale R.D., Liu E.T., Brusic V., Quackenbush J.,
RA   Wahlestedt C., Mattick J.S., Hume D.A., Kai C., Sasaki D., Tomaru Y.,
RA   Fukuda S., Kanamori-Katayama M., Suzuki M., Aoki J., Arakawa T.,
RA   Iida J., Imamura K., Itoh M., Kato T., Kawaji H., Kawagashira N.,
RA   Kawashima T., Kojima M., Kondo S., Konno H., Nakano K., Ninomiya N.,
RA   Nishio T., Okada M., Plessy C., Shibata K., Shiraki T., Suzuki S.,
RA   Tagami M., Waki K., Watahiki A., Okamura-Oho Y., Suzuki H., Kawai J.,
RA   Hayashizaki Y.;
RT   "The transcriptional landscape of the mammalian genome.";
RL   Science 309:1559-1563(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme E2 that specifically acts
CC       with HECT-type and RBR family E3 ubiquitin-protein ligases. Does
CC       not function with most RING-containing E3 ubiquitin-protein
CC       ligases because it lacks intrinsic E3-independent reactivity with
CC       lysine: in contrast, it has activity with the RBR family E3
CC       enzymes, such as PARK2 and ARIH1, that function like function like
CC       RING-HECT hybrids. Accepts ubiquitin from the E1 complex and
CC       catalyzes its covalent attachment to other proteins. In vitro
CC       catalyzes 'Lys-11'-linked polyubiquitination. Involved in the
CC       selective degradation of short-lived and abnormal proteins. Down-
CC       regulated during the S-phase it is involved in progression through
CC       the cell cycle. Regulates nuclear hormone receptors
CC       transcriptional activity. May play a role in myelopoiesis (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + ubiquitin + protein lysine = AMP +
CC       diphosphate + protein N-ubiquityllysine. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00388, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10133}.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; protein ubiquitination.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00388}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with PARK2; involved in ubiquitination and
CC       degradation of misfolded proteins. Interacts with UBE3A. Interacts
CC       with CCNB1IP1, CBL, ZAP70, RNF19A, RNF19B and RNF144B. Interacts
CC       with ARIH1. Interacts with ARIH2 (via RING-type 1). Interacts with
CC       NCOA1; they functionally interact to regulate progesterone
CC       receptor transcriptional activity (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: In contrast to other ubiquitin-conjugating enzymes E2,
CC       residues essential for lysine reactivity are absent: Pro and a His
CC       residues are present instead of an Asp and an Asp residues in
CC       positions 88 and 119,respectively. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated. The alteration of UBE2L3 protein levels during
CC       the S-phase of the cell cycle is due to ubiquitin-dependent
CC       proteasomal degradation (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme family.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00388}.

RP   OXIDATION AT MET-46 AND MET-49, AND DEOXIDATION AT MET-46 AND MET-49.
RX   PubMed=23911929; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.019;
RA   Lee B.C., Peterfi Z., Hoffmann F.W., Moore R.E., Kaya A., Avanesov A.,
RA   Tarrago L., Zhou Y., Weerapana E., Fomenko D.E., Hoffmann P.R.,
RA   Gladyshev V.N.;
RT   "MsrB1 and MICALs regulate actin assembly and macrophage function via
RT   reversible stereoselective methionine oxidation.";
RL   Mol. Cell 51:397-404(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Actins are highly conserved proteins that are involved
CC       in various types of cell motility and are ubiquitously expressed
CC       in all eukaryotic cells.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Polymerization of globular actin (G-actin) leads to a
CC       structural filament (F-actin) in the form of a two-stranded helix.
CC       Each actin can bind to 4 others.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton.
CC   -!- PTM: Oxidation of Met-46 and Met-49 by MICALs (MICAL1, MICAL2 or
CC       MICAL3) to form methionine sulfoxide promotes actin filament
CC       depolymerization. MICAL1 and MICAL2 produce the (R)-S-oxide form.
CC       The (R)-S-oxide form is reverted by MSRB1 and MSRB2, which promote
CC       actin repolymerization. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23911929}.
CC   -!- PTM: Monomethylation at Lys-86 (K84me1) regulates actin-myosin
CC       interaction and actomyosin-dependent processes. Demethylation by
CC       ALKBH4 is required for maintaining actomyosin dynamics supporting
CC       normal cleavage furrow ingression during cytokinesis and cell
CC       migration (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: In vertebrates 3 main groups of actin isoforms,
CC       alpha, beta and gamma have been identified. The alpha actins are
CC       found in muscle tissues and are a major constituent of the
CC       contractile apparatus. The beta and gamma actins coexist in most
CC       cell types as components of the cytoskeleton and as mediators of
CC       internal cell motility.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the actin family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, AND INDUCTION.
RX   PubMed=16061649; DOI=10.1158/0008-5472.CAN-04-4223;
RA   Tsuchihara K., Lapin V., Bakal C., Okada H., Brown L.,

RT   "Ckap2 regulates aneuploidy, cell cycling, and cell death in a p53-
RT   dependent manner.";
RL   Cancer Res. 65:6685-6691(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Possesses microtubule stabilizing properties. Involved
CC       in regulating aneuploidy, cell cycling, and cell death in a p53-
CC       dependent manner. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15504249,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16061649}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Associates with alpha- and beta-tubulins.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton. Cytoplasm,
CC       cytoskeleton, spindle. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton, spindle pole.
CC       Note=Contrary to the ectopically expressed protein, endogenous
CC       CKAP2 does not colocalize with microtubules in G1, S and early G2.
CC       At late G2 and prophase after separation of duplicated
CC       centrosomes, colocalizes with gamma-tubulin and centrosome-
CC       proximal microtubules. From prometaphase through anaphase B,
CC       colocalizes with mitotic spindle poles and spindle microtubules.
CC       During cytokinesis, absent from midbody microtubules (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By constitutively activated RET proteins. By p53/TP53.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15504249, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16061649}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the CKAP2 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAC28747.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA] (ISOFORM 1).
RC   TISSUE=Trophoblast stem cell;
RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;
RG   The MGC Project Team;

RN   [6]
RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT SER-229, AND IDENTIFICATION
RP   BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=17242355; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0609836104;
RA   Villen J., Beausoleil S.A., Gerber S.A., Gygi S.P.;
RT   "Large-scale phosphorylation analysis of mouse liver.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 104:1488-1493(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Hydrolase that removes conjugated ubiquitin from target
CC       proteins and regulates various pathways such as the TGF-beta
CC       receptor signaling and NF-kappa-B pathways. Acts as a key
CC       regulator of TGF-beta receptor signaling pathway, but the precise
CC       mechanism is still unclear: according to a report, acts by
CC       promoting deubiquitination of monoubiquitinated R-SMADs (SMAD1,
CC       SMAD2 and/or SMAD3), thereby alleviating inhibition of R-SMADs and
CC       promoting activation of TGF-beta target genes. According to
CC       another reports, regulates the TGF-beta receptor signaling pathway
CC       by mediating deubiquitination and stabilization of TGFBR1, leading
CC       to an enhanced TGF-beta signal. Able to mediate deubiquitination
CC       of monoubiquitinated substrates as well as 'Lys-48'-linked
CC       polyubiquitin chains, protecting them against proteasomal
CC       degradation. May also regulate gene expression and/or DNA repair
CC       through the deubiquitination of histone H2B. Acts as an associated
CC       component of COP9 signalosome complex (CSN) and regulates
CC       different pathways via this association: regulates NF-kappa-B by
CC       mediating deubiquitination of NFKBIA and deubiquitinates
CC       substrates bound to VCP. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9Y4E8}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Thiol-dependent hydrolysis of ester,
CC       thioester, amide, peptide and isopeptide bonds formed by the C-
CC       terminal Gly of ubiquitin (a 76-residue protein attached to
CC       proteins as an intracellular targeting signal).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Identified in a complex with the COP9 signalosome complex
CC       (CSN). Interacts with SMAD1, SMAD2 and SMAD3; the interaction is
CC       direct. Forms a complex with SMURF2 and SMAD7. Interacts with
CC       TGFBR1. Interacts with SART3; the interaction is direct. May
CC       interact with RNF20 and RNF40. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9Y4E8}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=5;
CC         Comment=Experimental confirmation may be lacking for some
CC         isoforms.;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q8R5H1-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q8R5H1-2; Sequence=VSP_005262, VSP_005263;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q8R5H1-3; Sequence=VSP_005264;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=Q8R5H1-4; Sequence=VSP_005265, VSP_005266;
CC       Name=5;
CC         IsoId=Q8R5H1-5; Sequence=VSP_005263;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed with highest levels in
CC       testis, heart and liver. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12532266}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated. Phosphorylation protects against
CC       ubiquitination and subsequent degradation by the proteasome (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated, leading to degradation by the proteasome.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the peptidase C19 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 DUSP domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00613}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 USP domain. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [8]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (3.0 ANGSTROMS) IN COMPLEX WITH THE SOMATOSTATIN
RP   CAMP RESPONSE ELEMENT (SSCRE).
RX   PubMed=10952992; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M007293200;
RA   Schumacher M.A., Goodman R.H., Brennan R.G.;
RT   "The structure of a CREB bZIP.somatostatin CRE complex reveals the
RT   basis for selective dimerization and divalent cation-enhanced DNA
RT   binding.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 275:35242-35247(2000).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Phosphorylation-dependent transcription factor that
CC       stimulates transcription upon binding to the DNA cAMP response
CC       element (CRE), a sequence present in many viral and cellular
CC       promoters. Transcription activation is enhanced by the TORC
CC       coactivators which act independently of Ser-133 phosphorylation.
CC       Involved in different cellular processes including the
CC       synchronization of circadian rhythmicity and the differentiation
CC       of adipose cells. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11970866,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21728997}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with PPRC1. Binds DNA as a dimer. This dimer is
CC       stabilized by magnesium ions. Interacts, through the bZIP domain,
CC       with the coactivators TORC1/CRTC1, TORC2/CRTC2 and TORC3/CRTC3.
CC       Interacts (phosphorylated form) with TOX3 (By similarity). When
CC       phosphorylated on Ser-133, binds CREBBP. Interacts with ARRB1.
CC       Binds to HIPK2 (By similarity). Interacts with SGK1 (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with CREBL2; regulates CREB1
CC       phosphorylation, stability and transcriptional activity.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10952992,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21728997, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8552098}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P45481:Crebbp; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-2291098, EBI-296306;
CC       Q32M00:Crebl2; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-2291098, EBI-5314489;
CC       Q09472:EP300 (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-2291098, EBI-447295;
CC       Q60974:Ncor1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-2291098, EBI-349004;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00312, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00978,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21728997}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC         Comment=At least 6 isoforms are produced.;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q01147-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=CREB-delta;
CC         IsoId=Q01147-2; Sequence=VSP_000597;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Ubiquitously expressed.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:1387109}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylation of Ser-133 allows CREBBP binding. Stimulated
CC       by phosphorylation. Phosphorylated Ser-142 can be detected in the
CC       suprachiasmatic nucleus (SCN), the amygdala, the cortex, and the
CC       hippocampus but not in the striatum nor in the cerebellum. In the
CC       SCN, phosphorylation of Ser-142 and Ser-133 are stimulated by
CC       light exposure and submitted to circadian oscillations. In the
CC       retina, only phosphorylation of Ser-133 can be detected upon light
CC       exposure. Phosphorylation of both Ser-133 and Ser-142 in the SCN
CC       regulates the activity of CREB and participates in circadian
CC       rhythm generation. Phosphorylated upon calcium influx by CaMK4 and
CC       CaMK2 on Ser-133. CaMK4 is much more potent than CAMK2 in
CC       activating CREB. Phosphorylated by CaMK2 on Ser-142.
CC       Phosphorylation of Ser-142 blocks CREB-mediated transcription even
CC       when Ser-133 is phosphorylated. Phosphorylated by CaMK1.
CC       Phosphorylation of Ser-271 by HIPK2 in response to genotoxic
CC       stress promotes CREB1 activity, facilitating the recruitment of
CC       the coactivator CBP (By similarity). Phosphorylated at Ser-133 by
CC       RPS6KA3, RPS6KA4 and RPS6KA5 in response to mitogenic or stress
CC       stimuli. CREBL2 positively regulates phosphorylation at Ser-133
CC       thereby stimulating CREB1 transcriptional activity. In liver,
CC       phosphorylation is induced by fasting or glucagon in a circadian
CC       fashion. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11970866,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18690222, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20852621,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8552098}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylated with SUMO1. Sumoylation on Lys-304, but not on
CC       Lys-285, is required for nuclear localization of this protein.
CC       Sumoylation is enhanced under hypoxia, promoting nuclear
CC       localization and stabilization (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the bZIP family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 bZIP (basic-leucine zipper) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00978}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 KID (kinase-inducible) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00312}.

RP   FUNCTION, AND DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RX   PubMed=18974114; DOI=10.1158/0008-5472.CAN-08-1467;
RA   Hoare S., Hoare K., Reinhard M.K., Lee Y.J., Oh S.P., May W.S. Jr.;
RT   "Tnk1/Kos1 knockout mice develop spontaneous tumors.";
RL   Cancer Res. 68:8723-8732(2008).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: May function in signaling pathways utilized broadly
CC       during fetal development and more selectively in adult tissues and
CC       in cells of the lymphohematopoietic system. Could specifically be
CC       involved in phospholipid signal transduction (By similarity).
CC       Involved in negative regulation of cell growth. Has tumor
CC       suppressor properties. Plays a negative regulatory role in the
CC       Ras-MAPK pathway. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12789265,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18974114}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + a [protein]-L-tyrosine = ADP + a
CC       [protein]-L-tyrosine phosphate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10028}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with the SH3 domain of PLCG1 via its Pro-rich
CC       domain. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q13470}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12789265}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1 {ECO:0000269|Ref.2};
CC         IsoId=Q99ML2-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2 {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12789265};
CC         IsoId=Q99ML2-2; Sequence=VSP_051664, VSP_051665;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in whole embryo and all adult
CC       tissues examined including liver, kidney, heart, brain, skeletal
CC       muscle and intestine. Also detected in various myeloid- and
CC       lymphoid-derived cell lines. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12789265}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expression during embryogenesis increases
CC       between E7 and E11. Levels of expression subsequently decrease and
CC       reach a steady-state level by E17. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12789265}.
CC   -!- PTM: Autophosphorylated on tyrosine residues.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12789265}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Mice develop spontaneous tumors, including
CC       lymphomas and carcinomas at high rates.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18974114}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. Tyr protein
CC       kinase family. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00159}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 protein kinase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00159}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 SH3 domain. {ECO:0000255}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: mRNA-capping methyltransferase that methylates the N7
CC       position of the added guanosine to the 5'-cap structure of mRNAs.
CC       Binds RNA containing 5'-terminal GpppC (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: S-adenosyl-L-methionine + G(5')pppR-RNA = S-
CC       adenosyl-L-homocysteine + m(7)G(5')pppR-RNA. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00895}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with importin alpha, leading to stimulate both
CC       RNA-binding and methyltransferase activity. Interaction with
CC       importin alpha and beta is required for its nuclear localization,
CC       importin beta dissociating in response to RanGTP, allowing RNMT-
CC       importin alpha to bind RNA substrates. Interacts with elongating
CC       form of polymerase II and RNGTT. Interacts with RAM/FAM103A1, the
CC       interaction significantly enhances RNA-binding and cap
CC       methyltransferase activity (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9D0L8-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9D0L8-2; Sequence=VSP_020243;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q9D0L8-3; Sequence=VSP_020242;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the class I-like SAM-binding
CC       methyltransferase superfamily. mRNA cap 0 methyltransferase
CC       family. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00895}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 mRNA cap 0 methyltransferase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00895}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for proper homologous chromosome pairing and
CC       efficient cross-over and intragenic recombination during meiosis.
CC       Stimulates both DMC1- and RAD51-mediated homologous strand
CC       assimilation, which is required for the resolution of meiotic
CC       double-strand breaks. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15834424,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16675459, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17426123,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17639081}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer with PSMC3IP/HOP2. MND1-PSMC3IP interacts
CC       with DMC1 and RAD51 and binds to ssDNA and dsDNA showing no
CC       preference for either form of DNA. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15834424,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16675459}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the MND1 family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   FUNCTION, INTERACTION WITH COBL, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, AND TISSUE
RP   SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=23223303; DOI=10.1523/JNEUROSCI.0843-12.2012;
RA   Haag N., Schwintzer L., Ahuja R., Koch N., Grimm J., Heuer H.,
RA   Qualmann B., Kessels M.M.;
RT   "The actin nucleator Cobl is crucial for Purkinje cell development and
RT   works in close conjunction with the F-actin binding protein Abp1.";
RL   J. Neurosci. 32:17842-17856(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Adapter protein that binds F-actin and DNM1, and thereby
CC       plays a role in receptor-mediated endocytosis. Plays a role in the
CC       reorganization of the actin cytoskeleton, formation of cell
CC       projections, such as neurites, in neuron morphogenesis and synapse
CC       formation via its interaction with WASL and COBL. Does not bind G-
CC       actin and promote actin polymerization by itself. Required for the
CC       formation of organized podosome rosettes. May act as a common
CC       effector of antigen receptor-signaling pathways in leukocytes.
CC       Acts as a key component of the immunological synapse that
CC       regulates T-cell activation by bridging TCRs and the actin
CC       cytoskeleton to gene activation and endocytic processes.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11309416, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17476322,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18829961, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22303001,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23223303}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with SHANK3, SYN1 and PRAM1 (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with SHANK2. Interacts with FGD1, DNM1 and MAP4K1.
CC       Interacts with ANKRD54. Interacts with COBL. Interacts with WASL
CC       and WIPF1. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10637315,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11309416, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12913069,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17476322, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18829961,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19064729, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22303001,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23223303}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton. Cell projection,
CC       lamellipodium. Cell projection, ruffle. Cytoplasm, cell cortex.
CC       Cytoplasm, cytosol {ECO:0000250}. Cell junction, synapse
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Cell projection {ECO:0000250}. Cell membrane;
CC       Peripheral membrane protein; Cytoplasmic side. Cytoplasmic
CC       vesicle, clathrin-coated vesicle membrane; Peripheral membrane
CC       protein; Cytoplasmic side. Golgi apparatus membrane; Peripheral
CC       membrane protein; Cytoplasmic side. Cell projection, podosome.
CC       Note=Detected in neuron cell body and cell projections, such as
CC       neurites. Colocalizes with cytosolic dynamin in hippocampus
CC       neurons (By similarity). Cortical actin cytoskeleton. Associates
CC       with lamellipodial actin and membrane ruffles. Colocalizes with
CC       actin and cortactin at podosome dots and podosome rosettes.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1 {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12913069};
CC         IsoId=Q62418-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2 {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9891087};
CC         IsoId=Q62418-2; Sequence=VSP_050790;
CC       Name=3 {ECO:0000305};
CC         IsoId=Q62418-3; Sequence=VSP_050789;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in hippocampus neurons and in the
CC       Purkinje cell layer in cerebellum (at protein level).
CC       Predominantly expressed in brain, thymus and spleen. Also found in
CC       testis, heart and lung. Little or no expression detected in ovary
CC       or muscle. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10637315,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23223303, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9891087}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: In the embryo, expression is high during
CC       early development but drops during later development.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10637315}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The SH3 domain mediates interaction with SHANK2, SHANK3
CC       and PRAM1. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the ABP1 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 ADF-H domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00599}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 SH3 domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00192}.

RP   INTERACTION WITH SNX6.
RX   PubMed=19935774; DOI=10.1038/cr.2009.130;
RA   Hong Z., Yang Y., Zhang C., Niu Y., Li K., Zhao X., Liu J.J.;
RT   "The retromer component SNX6 interacts with dynactin p150(Glued) and

RL   Cell Res. 19:1334-1349(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for the cytoplasmic dynein-driven retrograde
CC       movement of vesicles and organelles along microtubules. Dynein-
CC       dynactin interaction is a key component of the mechanism of axonal
CC       transport of vesicles and organelles.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Large macromolecular complex of at least 10 components;
CC       p150(glued) binds directly to microtubules and to cytoplasmic
CC       dynein. Interacts with the C-terminus of MAPRE1, MAPRE2 and
CC       MAPRE3. Interacts with FBXL5. Interacts with ECM29. Interacts with
CC       CLIP1. Interacts with CLN3 and DYNAP. Interacts with MISP; this
CC       interaction regulates its distribution at the cell cortex.
CC       Interacts with CEP131 (By similarity). Interacts with SNX6
CC       (PubMed:19935774). Interacts with KIAA1377 (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q14203, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19935774}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P28741:Kif3a; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-776180, EBI-6169413;
CC       P33175:Kif5a; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-776180, EBI-349710;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton.
CC       Note=Colocalizes with microtubules. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=O08788-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=O08788-2; Sequence=VSP_029584;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated by a SCF complex containing FBXL5, leading to
CC       its degradation by the proteasome. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the dynactin 150 kDa subunit family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Dephosphorylates the 5' and 2'(3')-phosphates of
CC       deoxyribonucleotides, with a preference for dUMP and dTMP,
CC       intermediate activity towards dGMP, and low activity towards dCMP
CC       and dAMP. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10681516}.

RP   FUNCTION, INTERACTION WITH CDK16, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=22184064; DOI=10.1128/MCB.06261-11;
RA   Mikolcevic P., Sigl R., Rauch V., Hess M.W., Pfaller K., Barisic M.,
RA   Pelliniemi L.J., Boesl M., Geley S.;
RT   "Cyclin-dependent kinase 16/PCTAIRE kinase 1 is activated by cyclin Y
RT   and is essential for spermatogenesis.";
RL   Mol. Cell. Biol. 32:868-879(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Positive regulatory subunit of the cyclin-dependent
CC       kinase CDK14/PFTK1. Acts as a cell-cycle regulator of Wnt
CC       signaling pathway during G2/M phase by recruiting CDK14/PFTK1 to
CC       the plasma membrane and promoting phosphorylation of LRP6, leading
CC       to the activation of the Wnt signaling pathway (By similarity).
CC       Recruits CDK16 to the plasma membrane (By similarity). Positive
CC       regulatory subunit of the cyclin-dependent kinase CDK16.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22184064}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with CDK14 and LRP6 (By similarity). Interacts
CC       with CDK16. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22184064}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000250}; Lipid-anchor
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Cytoplasmic side {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q8BGU5-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q8BGU5-2; Sequence=VSP_014835;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in brain, heart, lung, skeletal
CC       muscle, ovary, thymus and testis (at protein level).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22184064}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated; leading to its degradation. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Heavily phosphorylated. Phosphorylation at Ser-71 and Ser-73
CC       by CDK14 is enhanced during the G2 and M cell cycle phases, and
CC       creates a phosphodegron triggering SCF-dependent ubiquitination.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8ND76}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the cyclin family. Cyclin Y subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 cyclin N-terminal domain. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Possesses thioredoxin activity. Has been shown to reduce
CC       insulin disulfide bonds. Also complements protein disulfide-
CC       isomerase deficiency in yeast. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12930873,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:14971039}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum lumen
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10138,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12930873}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed at high levels in plasma cells and
CC       at very low levels in all other cells and tissues examined (at
CC       protein level). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14971039}.

RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RX   PubMed=19144319; DOI=10.1016/j.immuni.2008.11.006;
RA   Trost M., English L., Lemieux S., Courcelles M., Desjardins M.,

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the anaphase promoting complex/cyclosome
CC       (APC/C), a cell cycle-regulated E3 ubiquitin ligase that controls
CC       progression through mitosis and the G1 phase of the cell cycle.
CC       The APC/C complex acts by mediating ubiquitination and subsequent
CC       degradation of target proteins: it mainly mediates the formation
CC       of 'Lys-11'-linked polyubiquitin chains and, to a lower extent,
CC       the formation of 'Lys-48'- and 'Lys-63'-linked polyubiquitin
CC       chains (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; protein ubiquitination.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The mammalian APC/C is composed of 14 distinct subunits
CC       that assemble into a complex of at least 19 chains with a combined
CC       molecular mass of around 1.2 MDa. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UJX5}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the APC4 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAB27965.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Atypical tyrosine-protein kinase that plays a central
CC       role in chromatin remodeling and acts as a transcription
CC       regulator. Involved in DNA damage response by phosphorylating
CC       'Tyr-142' of histone H2AX (H2AXY142ph). H2AXY142ph plays a central
CC       role in DNA repair and acts as a mark that distinguishes between
CC       apoptotic and repair responses to genotoxic stress. Essential
CC       component of the WICH complex, a chromatin remodeling complex that
CC       mobilizes nucleosomes and reconfigures irregular chromatin to a
CC       regular nucleosomal array structure. The WICH complex regulates
CC       the transcription of various genes, has a role in RNA polymerase I
CC       and RNA polymerase III transcription, mediates the histone H2AX
CC       phosphorylation at 'Tyr-142', and is involved in the maintenance
CC       of chromatin structures during DNA replication processes. In the
CC       complex, it mediates the recruitment of the WICH complex to
CC       replication foci during DNA replication. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + a [protein]-L-tyrosine = ADP + a
CC       [protein]-L-tyrosine phosphate.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Mn(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29035; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with MYO1C (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       CDT1. Interacts with SMARCA5/SNF2H; the interaction is direct and
CC       forms the WICH complex. Component of the B-WICH complex, at least
CC       composed of SMARCA5/SNF2H, BAZ1B/WSTF, SF3B1, DEK, MYO1C, ERCC6,
CC       MYBBP1A and DDX21. Interacts with VDR; in a ligand-dependent
CC       manner. Interacts with PCNA; the interaction is direct (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q91ZW3:Smarca5; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-927576, EBI-927547;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00063, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00475}.
CC       Note=Accumulates in pericentromeric heterochromatin during
CC       replication. Targeted to replication foci throughout S phase via
CC       its association with PCNA (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9Z277-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9Z277-2; Sequence=VSP_037470;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed as early as day 7 and in equal
CC       amounts during gestation.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The N-terminal part, including the WAC domain and the C
CC       motif, mediates the tyrosine-protein kinase activity.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The bromo domain mediates the specific interaction with
CC       acetylated histones. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the WAL family. BAZ1B subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 bromo domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00035}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 DDT domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00063}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PHD-type zinc finger. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00146}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 WAC domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00475}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in stress resistance and actin organization.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Associates with alpha- and beta-tubulin, microtubules and
CC       CRYAB. Interacts with HSPB8 (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       HSPBAP1 and TGFB1I1. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10751411,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11546764}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton, spindle {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Cytoplasmic in interphase cells. Colocalizes with mitotic
CC       spindles in mitotic cells. Translocates to the nucleus during heat
CC       shock and resides in sub-nuclear structures known as SC35 speckles
CC       or nuclear splicing speckles (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC         Comment=Additional isoforms seem to exist.;
CC       Name=A;
CC         IsoId=P14602-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=B;
CC         IsoId=P14602-2; Sequence=VSP_002422;
CC       Name=C;
CC         IsoId=P14602-3; Sequence=VSP_002423;
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylation by MAPKAPK2 and MAPKAPK3 in response to
CC       stress leads to dissociate HSP27/HSPB1 from large small heat-shock
CC       protein (sHsps) oligomers and impair its chaperone activity and
CC       ability to protect against oxidative stress effectively.
CC       Phosphorylation by MAPKAPK5 in response to PKA stimulation induces
CC       F-actin rearrangement. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:1332886,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:1860870, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21575178,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8093612}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No visible phoenotype. Mice are viable and
CC       fertile with no apparent morphological abnormalities in tissues
CC       under physiological conditions. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17661394}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the small heat shock protein (HSP20)
CC       family. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00285}.

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-86; LYS-94; LYS-97; LYS-462
RP   AND LYS-500, AND IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE

RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=23576753; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1302961110;
RA   Rardin M.J., Newman J.C., Held J.M., Cusack M.P., Sorensen D.J.,
RA   Li B., Schilling B., Mooney S.D., Kahn C.R., Verdin E., Gibson B.W.;

RT   mitochondria identifies substrates of SIRT3 in metabolic pathways.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 110:6601-6606(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Multifunctional enzyme mediating important protective
CC       effects. Metabolizes betaine aldehyde to betaine, an important
CC       cellular osmolyte and methyl donor. Protects cells from oxidative
CC       stress by metabolizing a number of lipid peroxidation-derived
CC       aldehydes. Involved in lysine catabolism (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: (S)-2-amino-6-oxohexanoate + NAD(P)(+) + H(2)O
CC       = L-2-aminoadipate + NAD(P)H.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Betaine aldehyde + NAD(+) + H(2)O = betaine +
CC       NADH.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An aldehyde + NAD(+) + H(2)O = a carboxylate +
CC       NADH.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Amine and polyamine biosynthesis; betaine biosynthesis
CC       via choline pathway; betaine from betaine aldehyde: step 1/1.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P83402}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Mitochondrion {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20207735}.
CC       Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20207735}. Cytoplasm, cytosol
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20207735}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9DBF1-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9DBF1-2; Sequence=VSP_038989;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Present in liver, kidney, brain and pancreas,
CC       and at lower levels in jejunum, duodenum, stomach and testes (at
CC       protein level). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20207735}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the aldehyde dehydrogenase family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the reversible transfer of the terminal
CC       phosphate group between ATP and AMP. Also possesses broad
CC       nucleoside diphosphate kinase activity. Plays an important role in
CC       cellular energy homeostasis and in adenine nucleotide metabolism
CC       (By similarity). May provide a mechanism to buffer the adenylate
CC       energy charge for sperm motility. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16790685}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + AMP = 2 ADP. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03171}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + nucleoside diphosphate = ADP +
CC       nucleoside triphosphate. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03171}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03171}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03171}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Ak1a;
CC         IsoId=Q9R0Y5-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Ak1b;
CC         IsoId=Q9R0Y5-2; Sequence=VSP_024843;
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Up-regulated during late spermiogenesis, when
CC       the flagellum is being assembled. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16790685}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Consists of three domains, a large central CORE domain and
CC       two small peripheral domains, NMPbind and LID, which undergo
CC       movements during catalysis. The LID domain closes over the site of
CC       phosphoryl transfer upon ATP binding. Assembling and dissambling
CC       the active center during each catalytic cycle provides an
CC       effective means to prevent ATP hydrolysis. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03171}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the adenylate kinase family. AK1 subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03171}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=CAM16612.1; Type=Erroneous gene model prediction; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Specifically hydrolyzes 7-methylguanosine monophosphate
CC       (m(7)GMP) to 7-methylguanosine and inorganic phosphate. The
CC       specific activity for m(7)GMP may protect cells against undesired
CC       salvage of m(7)GMP and its incorporation into nucleic acids. Also
CC       has weak activity for CMP. UMP and purine nucleotides are poor
CC       substrates (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: N(7)-methyl-GMP + H(2)O = N(7)-methyl-
CC       guanosine + phosphate.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: CMP + H(2)O = cytidine + phosphate.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: A 5'-ribonucleotide + H(2)O = a ribonucleoside
CC       + phosphate.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=4;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q3UFY7-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q3UFY7-2; Sequence=VSP_032853, VSP_032854;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q3UFY7-3; Sequence=VSP_032851, VSP_032852;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=Q3UFY7-4; Sequence=VSP_046298;
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the pyrimidine 5'-nucleotidase family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Functions in mitochondrial tRNA maturation. Part of
CC       mitochondrial ribonuclease P, an enzyme composed of MRPP1/RG9MTD1,
CC       MRPP2/HSD17B10 and MRPP3/KIAA0391, which cleaves tRNA molecules in
CC       their 5'-ends (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with MRPP2/HSD17B10 and MRPP3/KIAA0391.
CC       Interacts with GRSF1 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Mitochondrion matrix, mitochondrion nucleoid
CC       {ECO:0000250}.

CC       ProRule:PRU01012}.

CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01012}.

RP   OXIDATION AT MET-45 AND MET-48, AND DEOXIDATION AT MET-45 AND MET-48.
RX   PubMed=23911929; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.019;
RA   Lee B.C., Peterfi Z., Hoffmann F.W., Moore R.E., Kaya A., Avanesov A.,
RA   Tarrago L., Zhou Y., Weerapana E., Fomenko D.E., Hoffmann P.R.,
RA   Gladyshev V.N.;
RT   "MsrB1 and MICALs regulate actin assembly and macrophage function via
RT   reversible stereoselective methionine oxidation.";
RL   Mol. Cell 51:397-404(2013).
RN   [4]
RP   TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=24337657; DOI=10.1007/s00439-013-1406-0;
RA   Thorson W., Diaz-Horta O., Foster J. II, Spiliopoulos M., Quintero R.,
RA   Farooq A., Blanton S., Tekin M.;
RT   "De novo ACTG2 mutations cause congenital distended bladder,
RT   microcolon, and intestinal hypoperistalsis.";
RL   Hum. Genet. 133:737-742(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Actins are highly conserved proteins that are involved
CC       in various types of cell motility and are ubiquitously expressed
CC       in all eukaryotic cells.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Polymerization of globular actin (G-actin) leads to a
CC       structural filament (F-actin) in the form of a two-stranded helix.
CC       Each actin can bind to 4 others.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in tissues containing smooth muscle
CC       particularly the intestines and bladder.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24337657}.
CC   -!- PTM: Oxidation of Met-45 and Met-48 by MICALs (MICAL1, MICAL2 or
CC       MICAL3) to form methionine sulfoxide promotes actin filament
CC       depolymerization. MICAL1 and MICAL2 produce the (R)-S-oxide form.
CC       The (R)-S-oxide form is reverted by MSRB1 and MSRB2, which promote
CC       actin repolymerization. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23911929}.
CC   -!- PTM: Monomethylation at Lys-85 (K84me1) regulates actin-myosin
CC       interaction and actomyosin-dependent processes. Demethylation by
CC       ALKBH4 is required for maintaining actomyosin dynamics supporting
CC       normal cleavage furrow ingression during cytokinesis and cell
CC       migration (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: In vertebrates 3 main groups of actin isoforms,
CC       alpha, beta and gamma have been identified. The alpha actins are
CC       found in muscle tissues and are a major constituent of the
CC       contractile apparatus. The beta and gamma actins coexist in most
CC       cell types as components of the cytoskeleton and as mediators of
CC       internal cell motility.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the actin family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA] OF 131-588.
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic tail;
RX   PubMed=14621295; DOI=10.1093/dnares/10.4.167;
RA   Okazaki N., Kikuno R., Ohara R., Inamoto S., Koseki H., Hiraoka S.,
RA   Saga Y., Nagase T., Ohara O., Koga H.;
RT   "Prediction of the coding sequences of mouse homologues of KIAA gene:
RT   III. The complete nucleotide sequences of 500 mouse KIAA-homologous
RT   cDNAs identified by screening of terminal sequences of cDNA clones
RT   randomly sampled from size-fractionated libraries.";
RL   DNA Res. 10:167-180(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Putative catalytic component of the RNA exosome complex
CC       which has 3'->5' exoribonuclease activity and participates in a
CC       multitude of cellular RNA processing and degradation events. In
CC       the nucleus, the RNA exosome complex is involved in proper
CC       maturation of stable RNA species such as rRNA, snRNA and snoRNA,
CC       in the elimination of RNA processing by-products and non-coding
CC       'pervasive' transcripts, such as antisense RNA species and
CC       promoter-upstream transcripts (PROMPTs), and of mRNAs with
CC       processing defects, thereby limiting or excluding their export to
CC       the cytoplasm. The RNA exosome may be involved in Ig class switch
CC       recombination (CSR) and/or Ig variable region somatic
CC       hypermutation (SHM) by targeting AICDA deamination activity to
CC       transcribed dsDNA substrates. In the cytoplasm, the RNA exosome
CC       complex is involved in general mRNA turnover and specifically
CC       degrades inherently unstable mRNAs containing AU-rich elements
CC       (AREs) within their 3' untranslated regions, and in RNA
CC       surveillance pathways, preventing translation of aberrant mRNAs.
CC       It seems to be involved in degradation of histone mRNA. DIS3 has
CC       both 3'-5' exonuclease and endonuclease activities (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Mg(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:18420; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Name=Mn(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29035; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the RNA exosome complex. The catalytically
CC       inactive RNA exosome core (Exo-9) complex is believed to associate
CC       with catalytic subunits EXOSC10, and DIS3 or DIS3L in cytoplasmic-
CC       and nuclear-specific RNA exosome complex forms (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus, nucleolus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus, nucleoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the RNR ribonuclease family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PINc domain. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAC98069.1; Type=Miscellaneous discrepancy; Note=Incompletely spliced mRNA.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-97, AND IDENTIFICATION BY
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Positively regulates the transcription of MTUS1 and
CC       negatively regulates the transcription of MTUS2/TIP150. With
CC       EEF1A1 and TXK, forms a complex that acts as a T-helper 1 (Th1)
CC       cell-specific transcription factor and binds the promoter of IFN-
CC       gamma to directly regulate its transcription, and is thus involved
CC       importantly in Th1 cytokine production (By similarity). Involved
CC       in the base excision repair (BER) pathway, by catalyzing the
CC       poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation of a limited number of acceptor proteins
CC       involved in chromatin architecture and in DNA metabolism. This
CC       modification follows DNA damages and appears as an obligatory step
CC       in a detection/signaling pathway leading to the reparation of DNA
CC       strand breaks. Mediates the poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation of APLF and
CC       CHFR. Required for PARP9 and DTX3L recruitment to DNA damage
CC       sites. PARP1-dependent PARP9-DTX3L-mediated ubiquitination
CC       promotes the rapid and specific recruitment of 53BP1/TP53BP1,
CC       UIMC1/RAP80, and BRCA1 to DNA damage sites (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: NAD(+) + (ADP-D-ribosyl)(n)-acceptor =
CC       nicotinamide + (ADP-D-ribosyl)(n+1)-acceptor.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00397}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of a base excision repair (BER) complex,
CC       containing at least XRCC1, PARP2, POLB and LRIG3. Homo- and
CC       heterodimer with PARP2. Interacts with PARP3, APTX and SRY
CC       Interacts (when poly-ADP-ribosylated) with CHD1L. Interacts with
CC       the DNA polymerase alpha catalytic subunit POLA1; this interaction
CC       functions as part of the control of replication fork progression
CC       (By similarity). The SWAP complex consists of NPM1, NCL, PARP1 and
CC       SWAP70. Interacts with TIAM2 and ZNF423. Interacts with RNF4.
CC       Interacts with EEF1A1 and TXK (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       RNF146 (By similarity). Interacts with SNAI1 (via zinc fingers);
CC       the interaction requires SNAI1 to be poly-ADP-ribosylated and non-
CC       phosphorylated (active) by GSK3B. Interacts (when poly-ADP-
CC       ribosylated) with PARP9 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P03087:- (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-642213, EBI-1555770;
CC       Q9WTL8:Arntl; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-642213, EBI-644534;
CC       P70677:Casp3; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-642213, EBI-1790419;
CC       P97864:Casp7; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-642213, EBI-5307197;
CC       P20263:Pou5f1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-642213, EBI-1606219;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Nucleus, nucleolus {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Localizes at sites of DNA damage. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative initiation; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Long;
CC         IsoId=P11103-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Short, sPARP-1;
CC         IsoId=P11103-2; Sequence=VSP_018970;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed. Expression is correlated
CC       with proliferation, with higher levels occurring during early
CC       fetal development and organogenesis and in the highly
CC       proliferative cell compartments of adult. Expressed in B-cells
CC       that have been induced to switch to various Ig isotypes.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9642267}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: At stage E12.5, expressed at high level in
CC       the developing liver and kidneys. Expressed at higher level in the
CC       genital ridge and the spinal ganglia. At E18.5, preferentially
CC       expressed in the thymus and in regions of the nervous system.
CC       Within the developing trunk, preferential expression persisted in
CC       the liver and became restricted to the cortical region of the
CC       kidney, spleen, adrenal gland, and to stomach and intestinal
CC       epithelia. From E14.5 to E18.5, as well as in the adult, expressed
CC       at the highest level in thymus. Expression is particularly high in
CC       the subcapsular zone of the thymus where immature lymphocytes
CC       proliferate. Expressed at high level in the seminiferous tubules
CC       of the developing testis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11948190}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated by PRKDC and TXK.
CC   -!- PTM: Poly-ADP-ribosylated by PARP2. Poly-ADP-ribosylation mediates
CC       the recruitment of CHD1L to DNA damage sites (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: S-nitrosylated, leading to inhibit transcription regulation
CC       activity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16464859}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Mice show a complete lack of nuclear
CC       poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation. Mice are however viable and fertile.
CC       Moreover, repair of UV and MNNG induced DNA damage are not
CC       affected. However, about 30% of the mutant mice developed
CC       pathological skin aberrations on a mixed 129/Sv x C57B1/6 genetic
CC       background. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7578427}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The ADP-D-ribosyl group of NAD(+) is transferred to
CC       an acceptor carboxyl group on a histone or the enzyme itself, and
CC       further ADP-ribosyl groups are transferred to the 2'-position of
CC       the terminal adenosine moiety, building up a polymer with an
CC       average chain length of 20-30 units.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 BRCT domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00033}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PARP alpha-helical domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00398}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PARP catalytic domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00397}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 PARP-type zinc fingers.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00264}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAF61293.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent methyltransferase that
CC       specifically methylates the N(7) position of a guanine in 18S
CC       rRNA. Important for biogenesis end export of the 40S ribosomal
CC       subunit independent on its methyltransferase activity. Locus-
CC       specific steroid receptor coactivator. Potentiates transactivation
CC       by glucocorticoid (NR3C1), mineralocorticoid (NR3C2), androgen
CC       (AR) and progesterone (PGR) receptors. Required for the
CC       maintenance of open chromatin at the TSC22D3/GILZ locus to
CC       facilitate NR3C1 loading on the response elements. Required for
CC       maintenance of dimethylation on histone H3 'Lys-79' (H3K79me2) (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: S-adenosyl-L-methionine + guanine in 18S rRNA
CC       = S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine + N(7)-methylguanine in 18S rRNA.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with GRIP1. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Localized diffusely throughout the nucleus and
CC       the cytoplasm. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: May be ubiquitinated and targeted to degradation in response
CC       to proinflammatory cytokine signaling. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the class I-like SAM-binding
CC       methyltransferase superfamily. BUD23/WBSCR22 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-426, AND IDENTIFICATION BY
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Receptor-proximal protein kinase regulating integrin-
CC       mediated signal transduction. May act as a mediator of inside-out
CC       integrin signaling. Focal adhesion protein part of the complex
CC       ILK-PINCH. This complex is considered to be one of the convergence
CC       points of integrin- and growth factor-signaling pathway. Could be
CC       implicated in mediating cell architecture, adhesion to integrin
CC       substrates and anchorage-dependent growth in epithelial cells.
CC       Phosphorylates beta-1 and beta-3 integrin subunit on serine and
CC       threonine residues, but also AKT1 and GSK3B (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with the cytoplasmic domain of ITGB1. Could
CC       also interact with integrin ITGB2, ITGB3 and/or ITGB5. Interacts
CC       (via ANK repeats) with LIMS1 and LIMS2. Interacts with PARVA and
CC       PARVB. Interacts (via ANK repeats) with EPHA1 (via SAM domain);
CC       stimulated by EFNA1 but independent of the kinase activity of
CC       EPHA1 (By similarity). Interacts with TGFB1I1. Interacts with
CC       FERMT2. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16737959,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18483218}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P48059:LIMS1 (xeno); NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-6690138, EBI-306928;
CC       Q9EPC1:Parva; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-6690138, EBI-6690233;
CC       Q9ES46:Parvb; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-6690138, EBI-6914996;
CC       Q9WUD1:Stub1; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-6690138, EBI-773027;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell junction, focal adhesion. Cell membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Peripheral membrane protein {ECO:0000250};
CC       Cytoplasmic side {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm, myofibril, sarcomere
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Cell projection, lamellipodium.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in lung, heart, kidney,
CC       liver, brain, spleen and skeletal muscle. Weakly expressed in
CC       testis.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: A PH-like domain is involved in phosphatidylinositol
CC       phosphate binding. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Autophosphorylated on serine residues. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. TKL Ser/Thr
CC       protein kinase family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 5 ANK repeats. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00023}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 protein kinase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00159}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the exocyst complex involved in the docking
CC       of exocytic vesicles with fusion sites on the plasma membrane.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The exocyst complex is composed of EXOC1, EXOC2, EXOC3,
CC       EXOC4, EXOC5, EXOC6, EXOC7 and EXOC8. Interacts with EXOC3L1.
CC       Interacts with RALA and GNEFR/DELGEF. Interaction with GNEFR
CC       occurs only in the presence of magnesium or manganese and is
CC       stimulated by dCTP or GTP. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18480549}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Interacts with RALA through the TIG domain.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SEC5 family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Core component of multiple cullin-RING-based ECS
CC       (ElonginB/C-CUL2/5-SOCS-box protein) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase
CC       complexes, which mediate the ubiquitination of target proteins.
CC       May serve as a rigid scaffold in the complex and may contribute to
CC       catalysis through positioning of the substrate and the ubiquitin-
CC       conjugating enzyme. The E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase activity of
CC       the complex is dependent on the neddylation of the cullin subunit
CC       and is inhibited by the association of the deneddylated cullin
CC       subunit with TIP120A/CAND1 (By similarity). The functional
CC       specificity of the ECS complex depends on the substrate
CC       recognition component. ECS(VHL) mediates the ubiquitination of
CC       hypoxia-inducible factor (HIF) (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; protein ubiquitination.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of multiple ECS (Elongin BC-CUL2/5-SOCS-box
CC       protein) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complexes formed of CUL2,
CC       Elongin BC (TCEB1 and TCEB2), RBX1 and a variable substrate-
CC       specific adapter. Component of the ECS(VHL) or CBC(VHL) complex
CC       containing VHL. Component of the ECS(MED8) complex with the
CC       probable substrate recognition component MED8. Component of the
CC       ECS(LRR1) complex with the probable substrate recognition
CC       component LRR1. Component of a probable ECS E3 ubiquitin-protein
CC       ligase complex containing CUL2, RBX1, TCEB1, TCEB2 and FEM1B. Part
CC       of an E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex including ZYG11B, CUL2
CC       and Elongin BC. Part of an E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex
CC       including ZYG11BL, CUL2 and Elongin BC. Interacts with RBX1, RNF7,
CC       FEM1B and TIP120A/CAND1. Interacts with COPS2, and MED8. Interacts
CC       with human respiratory syncytial virus (HRSV) protein NS1. Found
CC       in a complex composed of LIMD1, VHL, EGLN1/PHD2, TCEB2 and CUL2.
CC       Interacts with KLHDC10; which may be an E3 ubiquitin ligase
CC       complex substrate recognition component.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11967155, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12149480}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9D4H8-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9D4H8-2; Sequence=VSP_008823;
CC   -!- PTM: CBC(VHL) complex formation seems to promote neddylation.
CC       Deneddylated via its interaction with the COP9 signalosome (CSN)
CC       complex.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the cullin family. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00330}.

RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Functions as ATP-binding component of the Arp2/3 complex
CC       which is involved in regulation of actin polymerization and
CC       together with an activating nucleation-promoting factor (NPF)
CC       mediates the formation of branched actin networks. Seems to
CC       contact the pointed end of the daughter actin filament. Plays a
CC       role in ciliogenesis (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the Arp2/3 complex composed of ARP2, ARP3,
CC       ARPC1B, ARPC1B/p41-ARC, ARPC2/p34-ARC, ARPC3/p21-ARC, ARPC4/p20-
CC       ARC and ARPC5/p16-ARC. Interacts with WHDC1. Interacts weakly with
CC       MEFV (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q60598:Cttn; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-773994, EBI-397955;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton {ECO:0000250}. Cell
CC       projection {ECO:0000250}. Note=In pre-apoptotic cells, colocalizes
CC       with MEFV in large specks (pyroptosomes). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the actin family. ARP3 subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
